function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Lack of proven treatment for covid-19","category":"Water","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Transmission of covid-19 through human-to-human contact","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases through human interaction in crowded areas such as corridors and rooms.","category":"Settlement","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Relying on sensor-only estimation of people flow","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Dependence on estimation methods for building occupancy","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited applicability of the proposed method to large-scale buildings","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Inaccurate estimation of people flows and occupancies","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lack of ground truth data for comparison","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Simulation software may not accurately reflect real-world situations","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Identification problem in people flow modeling","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Uncertainty in the state and measurement models","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Reliance on unknown parameters in people movement models for building occupancy estimation","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Inability to obtain real people flow data during emergency egress situations","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Computational expense and potential stability issues in optimization-based people flow estimation methods","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Unintuitive associations between the built environment be attributes and infection cases.","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Need for more spatially fine data to measure the influence of the built environment be attributes on disease spread.","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Association of built environment attributes with the spread of covid-19 in china","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Infection clusters in less dense areas","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Differences in the associations of built environment attributes in different geographical locations","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Restricting inter-city connections via railways may prevent the further spread of covid-19 in most cities of all levels.","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lowering the betweenness centrality could slow down the spread of future pandemics in over 70% of prefectural-level cities.","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reducing the population densities of built-up areas could be effective in preventing the spread of future pandemics in approximately 70.00 % of the province capitals.","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Association between the number of trains and the spread of covid-19","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Impact of population flow on covid-19 spread","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Effect of aging population percentage on covid-19 spread","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Positive coefficients of population flow correlated with higher infection ratios","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Positive correlation between population density and infection areas","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Positive association of between-ness centrality with the spread of covid-19 in cities under study, widely distributed in delta.","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Positive association between the percentage of aging population and the spread of covid-19 in certain cities in by public transport negatively related to infection ratio","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Standardized explanatory variables","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Assumption of spatial stationarity in explanatory variables in the mlr model","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Measuring the between-ness centrality of road networks surrounding railway stations may ignore other factors influencing disease spread.","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lack of Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High density of points of interest pois in urban areas","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate transportation infrastructure data for identifying high-risk areas","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of studies on china and its built environment attributes may lead to misunderstanding of the attributes in some cities may lead to incomplete understanding of the factors influencing disease spread in those areas.","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Omission of empirical
